review: 2 stars for the service and the kids food.  They messed up my fish tacos :(.  The fish was so over cooked that it didn't feel like I was eating fish.  It was missing flavor.  Too bad because our waiter gave us good service.  Don't think I will come back based on this experience.

A group of 5 ate dinner before the Distinguished Speakers series on Nov. 28,2017.  Two of the orders were totally wrong.  We had to wait for one salad to be made 3 times & not only was it still wrong, it came after the rest of us finished our dinners.  Two of the group have very specific food issues so no one was being picky to be difficult.  When we called the manager over, everything changed.  Amir could not have been nicer.  He followed up, apologized & took the two wrong orders off the check.  Most important was that he cared.  We would definitely be back.  I did not know how to rank the meal as the rest of the meal was good although the service was not consistent.

This CPK is by far the worst place i have ever picked up from being a Doordash driver. Every time i go in to pick up it is a long wait and never get helped or acknowledged and end up sitting there for about 10 minutes and another 10 minutes after while they get the food together. I would recommended ordering from somewhere else if your in a hurry or dont want to wait.

Not only did we have the best service ever by Maria Cutino, the food was amazing.  This was my first time at a California Pizza Kitchen.  With amazing service and food, it will not be look before I return.  Thank you!!!

CPK has long been a stand bye for me over the years. Beginning when I lived in Brentwood and was a regular at the San Vicente location and now being in Westlake Village it was the promenade which is now Lemonade and the Lakes location on TO blvd... 3.5 stars. I am still a big fan of the original BBQ Chicken chopped salad, Chicken Tequila Fettuccine, BBQ Chicken pizza and the Thai Chicken pizza unfortunately for my kids and I that's about it. Those (4) dishes are clearly a solid 4 - 4.5 stars and have been the market standard and replicated on virtually what seems like most every competing restaurant menu over the years.  The downside is the franchise has become stale and the menu and overall vibe has changed along with the prices which are a joke basically $15 - $17 per which as we all know the portions are small to say the least. I really like the location in the Lakes especially when my kids were younger and now it's more of a craving issue as i'm longing for the The original BBQ Chicken chopped salad or Chicken Tequila Fettuccine otherwise there are a wealth of better overall options to choose from. This location is clean and inviting, parking is easy and the adjacent outdoor sandbox, water features and swings are great if you have small kids... With that said enjoy one of the original game changers and know the landscape of what you are partaking!  CPK is more casual definitely not fine dining or romantic by any stretch of the imagination unless of course it's date night for a couple of computer programmers living on the edge with a sarsaparilla...

Beautiful location and prompt service from the staff. Came in after the lunch rush and sat there in peace for a quick business meeting and it was much appreciated. Would recommend this spot to any CPK fan. A big plus is the huge patio section which I assume, would be nice in the summer.

Food good as always. Service an absolute nightmare. I understand that servers forget things when asked, but over and over again? My favorite part was when we politely asked our moron of a server for certain little things, it was a huge burden. And he didn't hide his emotions well..also, if you happen to have Johnny as your food runner, don't even bother asking him for anything. The guy sucks.  CPK to go is your best option

Seated at the bar as the place was very busy. Enjoyed a great view of the fireplace. Warmly greeted by Christian who was our main server. Christian was personable, knowledgeable and efficient. If you were making a movie and needed a bartender Christian is your guy. Ordered squash/ veggie soup which was delicious and was consumed to the very last drop. Ordered a works pizza prepared by Pedro the pizza chef. Pizza was perfection!  A wonderful meal. Lots of hard working, talented, hard-working people at the California Pizza Kitchen who made for a wonderful experience.

Gee - I don't get it?  I see the average reviewer score is 3 stars when every time I've visited here I'd score AT LEAST 4 stars.  I confess my preference is to bestow 5 stars for the best of the best on multiple levels - so 4 stars from me is pretty good / from my point of view. So how was my visit?  I dropped in at 9 PM on a thursday for a mid evening snack with my daughters.  Service was prompt and expert / made easy I admit because there were but 3 or 4 tables occupied - the place was closing in an hour and it's sleepy mid week - eh? Service is on the spot prompt, cheerful and professional.  Servings were exactly as expected - with flavors right on.  We went in for pizzas... nothing special.  Our table and booth was spotless and clean - the worker I interrupted OUTSIDE - who was helping with drive up service handled my interruption cheerfully - my request for extra bread to go with our left overs to take home was handled without complaint - and the bathrooms were clean and well kept? So why not a 5 star visit?  I can't say except that nothing was really above and beyond?  CPK has usually been on the spot competent - plus on RARE occasion something in our to go - we cater a bit from them for business / various locations ... so yeah ... when catering sometimes things have been mildly amiss or not ready on time .  However on this evening all went well.  Just not spectacular... as we have encountered with other businesses.... sigh.

I love CPK, but this places service was non existent. Literally. The host was the only person who acknowledged me immediately and was kind. However, I sat outside for over 20 minutes without a drink order or even acknowledged. I thought maybe there was a single server who was busy, but I saw four different servers out on a patio with about a dozen tables only which 6 were filled. In addition, three of those servers looked at me, didn't even tell me when my server would be with me, and walked right past me. One server even checked on the table to my left, then skipped me, and took the check from the table to my right. She didn't even say she would be with me or asked if I had been helped.  I decided to wait another 10 minutes. And still nothing but random looks. Finally just got up and left when I saw a different group be immediately seated and served. Really disappointing.

Food was delicious. My server, Megan, was great! When she heard I was visiting from Colorado she surprised me with a free sample of their corn guacamole & chips. It was light and refreshing. Awesome experience!
Great food all the time and the service is on point. I would recommend this establishment to all my friends.

This restaurant may be good if you eat in but take out for the past two visits have been horrible. Food was missing sauces or barely had any sauce say on the mac & cheese asked for bread with five orders and received two little baggies with 4 tiny slices of a baguette just overall tasteless and quantities really really were lacking. Don't think I'll ever go back.
Always a family favorite. The new spinach artichoke pizza is delicious and great to share as an appetizer. Huge menu with lots of options. Great service.
I was very disappointed with the SHAVED MUSHROOM + SPINACH FLATBREAD I hardly could see the shaved mushroom or spinach. Doesn't worth the cost!

We walked in to try and get a spot at the bar (our usual habit) and there were two seats available that a couple just left. We thought to ourselves that we would wait a minute while the area was cleared and we could sit down. After waiting literally 15 minutes we walked out. Hopefully next time speed is improved.
I normally love CPK but was very disappointed tonight with the Shrimp Scampi Zucchini ... looked like the chef was too busy and threw it together - bland & boring!

Horrible experience with place!! Ordered over the phone for pick up and when we got home, ALL the food was wrong. My pasta had the wrong kind of pasta in it and our. Salad with requested extra lettuce had about 6 pieces in total. Not impressed and will not return. They should start checking orders and learning to communicate better with their call to order phone service.
I have never been disappointed: bbq chicken salad, potsticker app, hummus app, habanero pizza, chili relleno, garlic chicken pizza, butter cake (to die for)...that is all for now
Amazing service and friendly too with Tina. Food was great and the show stopper was desert .... Salted caramel pudding. Good wine highly recommend this place. Best CPK yet.
Gotta love the avocado rolls! Just can't get enough of them... it has always been good, tried the Thai Salad and was also pleasantly surprised!

What a lovely place to have lunch. The menu has so many options and the stuff are so nice and helpfull , unlike a different restaurants i'v been befor the food is coming really fast and everything is fresh. If you like pastas this is the palce for you.

Horrible customer service from hostess. My family and I came in for a diner in, were told 15 minutes wait time to be seated, then another 15 minutes were added, then another. Finally left and went to different place. Will not come back
Absolutely horrible customer service from Veronica, the store manager.Messed up the catering orders and super rude to customers! I have never encountered such an unprofessional customer service!

The restaurant was not busy at all. We asked for a booth. Two families were seated ahead of us in a booth. When the hostess showed us to our table I firmly told her (the same person I told the first time) we wanted a booth. That's really not hard to understand. I sat my family at the nearest booth. The guy had to clean it so we all had to get up while he cleaned and he was so rude to my 3 year old. The server took another 10 minutes to take our order. I asked for a mixed apple and orange juice for my kids, she gave me a look. Really?! The salad came out before the drinks did. No water was served either! Husband's cranberry juice was warm without ice. Asked her to add ice, she came back with a glass full of ice. Drinks finally came then food shortly after. She never came back to check on us. We wanted hot sauce so my husband got up and asked the nearest server. Bad service all around! I would never go back to this location!

Came for lunch and had a really awful waitress. She wreaked of cigarettes and was not at all attentive. Don't go sit in Michelle's section. She is not at all happy in her job clearly and I've never had such an unpleasant experience at any California pizza kitchen. I have the pizza dough reward app on my phone. I informed her when she came to take our order and gave her the check in code. She wrote it down. When the bill came, she didn't input my card. I knew I had $5 off from the rewards and I kindly asked her to add it to our bill. She told me she didn't see any reward but she would check. I told her it was on my phone. She said oh it might be something that you can only use on your next visit even though I had clearly walked into the restaurant with this reward so it would make zero sense that I would have to "return" to utilize it. I asked her to please check again. She never came back with info about the reward and asked us if the bill was all set as if I never had that conversation with her. I reminded her that she mentioned she was going to recheck the system for my $5 off.  She reluctantly checked. She told me the code wasn't working and to give her a phone number instead. I handed her my exact membership # and she rolled her eyes at me. Finally she came back and told us that she had found it.  And even though we had attached the credit card to the bill for her to swipe and gave her no attitude for her laziness, she managed to leave the "signature" portion of the check after the card has been swiped at the POS system. She came back and handed us a bill without the credit card signature authorization portion leaving both of us puzzled and frustrated. We were worried she was going to double charge after we informed her she didn't give us a signature receipt so I made sure to check the time stamps on the receipts to ensure it wasn't done twice on purpose. I would never come to her again and I believe she didn't want to honor the discount on purpose.  Also, our leftover pizza was not put in a nice box it was shoved into a little container. I'm really disappointed in how the service was here and probably would think twice about coming back.
Extremely slow service. Was seated on the patio. Sat and waited for 15-20 mins. No service. Got up and left. At least it was a nice day.

Beware of curbside completeness. I am disappointed with the customer service at this location. We typically have no issue with curbside pickup and understand things can go wrong- so tonight when we got home and realized the ice cream was missing from our dessert, we promptly called. We expected that the whole desert would have been adjusted from the bill. Instead, the manager took off the $2 charge of the ice cream. Highly disappointed.

Very disappointed Been coming to this locations for years regularly more than once a week. Very disappointed with today's experience my wife ordered a drink with us after 15 mins I had to walk inside to get it.  When we ordered food we said we were in a rush. Food took 30 mins plus with empty restaurant. Now they did take care of our check but we no longer live in Thousand Oaks so this was the only lunch we had together as a family on this trip. I would have preferred and enjoyable. Sorry to say you guys have lost a long time loyal customer

This is a great looking CPK, location is fantastic and its big and spacious. We got in before the rush and they were able to see us right away.  We had some kids at the table but the waiters took it all in stride.  They added some healthy items to the menu, I didn't have them, but I will look into it next time.

Well, color me shocked.  First of all, I thought I had already done a CPK review, and I hadn't.  Then, upon my thinking I would have to write a favorable review at that....color me even more shocked.  I honestly don't know if they've had an overhauling of their entire infrastructure or what, but my last visit there was quite pleasurable.  We went for my niece's birthday, as we do every year, and I always go in there with trepidation because I've never enjoyed it.  I just go because I'm honoring my niece and not my foodie snob self.  In years past, I found them to serve "just okay" food, minimal portions for which I'd leave wanting something more, and then charging me high prices just so I can be thoroughly disgruntled.  But.......... That was before......and this is now.  I can no longer make any of those statements.  I ordered a salad on their menu...... one of their newer salads, and I LOVED it.  It was so huge, I couldn't finish it.  I like that, too......then I feel like I'm getting my money's worth.  I ordered their Moroccan salad, which had an amazing assortment of ingredients, and lots of each item.......in addition to lettuce, tomatoes, and nicely marinated diced chicken, there was also roasted butternut squash, dates, avocado, toasted almonds, beets, chopped egg and cranberries, all tossed in a champagne vinaigrette, which was very light in flavor, but it made its presence known and complimented the salad nicely.  I actually find myself thinking of going back there just so I can get their salad.  I REALLY enjoyed it.  Who knew? Oh, they even served some really good, warm and fresh bread, which always seemed to elude any prior meal there.  Again, I think they've changed ....... and I can honestly say, for the MUCH better.
Cpk at the Lakes in Thousand Oaks has the slowest service. Do not come here. Disappointed in the service, will not come to this location again and will not recommend to friends.

I've been disappointed in general with the increase in prices, and decrease in food quality that has progressed over the years at CPK. However, the large group of teens that we are going to dinner with tonight really wanted to go to CPK tonght. I called this morning to make a reservation (for 10), and was told they would not make a same day reservation because there is a show at the nearby theater. I asked for the manager, and let them know, that nowhere on their yelp or their website does it say, no same day reservations, and in fact on Yelp under "reservations" it says "yes". He still said, sorry I can't give you a reservation. This is just the nail in the coffin. While I understand this may be their policy, it goes against what it says on Yelp, and it's just bad business for the manager to not offer a solution or alternative. One more reason to move our business over to PF Changs next door who happily took our reservation.

I loved the Sicilian pizza. The thin and crispy crust and the meaty topping was perfect. If you are looking for pizza that is a little different or fancy, this is the place. A must try is the S'mores. Its just yummy.

My daughters favorite place. I give it 4 stars because I wish they would be able to make the pizza for kids gluten free.  She loves t here but she has dietary restrictions and she can't eat a full size pizza. She is 4 years old.  I love the food and the staff is pretty good.

I walked into California pizza kitchen and the hostess is smiling, it was a warm and welcoming feeling. I was seated in moments, a short wait.  The waitress came over after noticed me overlooking the menu, and asked "if I would like to start with a drink". I replied "a large water please, and if possible can I try your split pea soup" she was more than happy to get me a sample to try. I waited for her to return and listen to my music. She came back and tried the soup it was interesting a little bland I went with the potato not as bland, paired nicely with a BBQ Chicken and avocado salad with lime juice drizzled over it. Delicious and healthy the waitress Heather that dropped it off was extremely nice and asked if I needed anything else with a brilliant smile and charm. I replied " no I am doing good thank you", I finished my meal and left.
Really poor service. Sat a a table for 25 minutes before any came by, then only an assistant manager. Still waiting for my bar drink.

Ordered take out last night...SUCH great service. I hate to say it, but usually when I order take out I expect something to be wrong or forgotten. DYLAN remembered everything we requested, and was fast with his service! The food was yummy too. :D

Dave is a great waiter! He recommended us to try the 101 beer! OMG! Absolutely delicious. We also ordered the chicken tequila fetuccini which was incredibly tasty as well as the chicken chipotle pizza.  You won't regreat having a meal here. :)

CPK is a chain restaurant and usually restaurants in this category are sub par at best. But CPK is the most constantly outstanding place of it's kind. The pizza is  phenomenal ( CA club is my favorite ) and the chicken piccata is the best I've ever had (fancy restaurants included). Every location is the same. Good food, Great service. I will always come back here!

We were greeted and helped by the best staff. Everyone wanted our experience to be a great one. Especially Kevin Zaruzua he moved to the speed of light to bring our lunch.  Yummy. The manager was very very pleasant. The food supreme

In town for Easter holiday with the family and only place we all could agree to eat at was CPK and SO GLAD WE DID!! The food was great as it always is no matter which location or state but the BEST TREAT OF ALL was our server.  Thank you 100 times TREVOR, our family is so glad you were working last night (Friday 4/18).  Not only was his personality pleasurable it was quite obvious he loves working for CPK and it showed.  He was very attentive to our needs, he made sure we had full drinks at all times, our food came out quickly and hot.  Overall we had a great dinner, great server, great time.  Thanks again Trevor!!!

Enjoyed a great luncheon with 20 people at California Pizza Kitchen last week for lunch following our Rosh Hoshana services. They accommodated us well. I had a tasty Cobb Salad that was very fresh. The server was prompt and delightful. Let's just say, I would definitely go back again. Thanks CPK.

We were hesitant to go back, but after a change in corporate ownership..let's try again Things have changed for the good it appears. Much better pizza than before, a BIG improvement on the bread served, and our waitress was really attentive and personable.I hope they keep this up !
Nice gluten free options is what keeps me coming back here. Oh, and the patio is always a fun place to dine :)
always exact same food so you always know you will get a dessent meal. nothing is amazing sadly with they would fun it up with their pizzas.

Kevin and I went here last night after a movie and knew we wouldn't have to wait for a table because of the hour. The host was a surly young man who definitely couldn't be bothered to at least say hello. After he seated us, he headed back over to the bar to watch whatever sports event was playing on the TV -- not a good impression.  Our server was prompt and somewhat friendly, but didn't offer anything in the way of suggestions. The wine by the glass list and menu choices are really good, so we were comfortable knowing our meal was going to be good.  The appetizer came relatively quickly, but again no engagement of conversation from the server. We noticed but were more engaged in the music that was playing in the background. It was a great playlist from One Eskimo, Rolling Stones, and Avett Brothers.  The entree choices were satisfying and prepared to our expectations. Generally, the evening was pleasant. When the server brought us the bill, we asked if they had XM Radio playing or if they had a prerecorded music list piped in. This was a young man in his 20's and he had no idea and looked as though he could care less.  I think that restaurant could use a major overhaul and fire the host and servers and hire replacements with personality!

Larger portions are usually a plus , Big fan of the Waldorf salad.   the raspberry ice tea is also a plus. it seems this is the only establishment in the whole shopping center that does well and isn't closing down. I went for lunch it was almost packed out the door.

I am a New Yorker, so yes I am probably a pizza snob. With a little nudge from my friend I ordered a pizza with pineapple and ham. An unholy topping combo by East Coast standards but actually, surprisingly, (don't tell any of my family back in NYC), good.  Yes, it was pretty good.  Tasty.  And the décor is nice too.

The wait was long, they forgot our food, we waited a long time for the second try of food to come... So why 5 stars? We didn't even have to complain. Both the waiter and the manager came to us and apologized for the mix up and long wait and comped our bill. They even offered for us to have dessert on them if we wanted, too. We understand things can happen, especially on a busy night, but really appreciate the great customer service we received. We will be back for sure!

Love the food...service tends to be a little on the slow side.  Any time I go I my lunch break, I always come back late cuz it takes forever to get the check or food or something...but it's always something.  Think I'll stick to dinner at CPK.

We came here for dinner in late 2012; haven't and likely won't be back.  We ordered a couple small pies to try them out.  The pizza was...ok, but nothing special.  The service was our concern.  It was slow throughout.  We were amused that the bread service was not much above taking a half-loaf of cold wonderbread on a plate and dropping it on the table. For the same price, we could go to Toppers, or any of the many other pizza places around.  If we're feeling like pizza, we probably will do that instead of CPK.

It's fine if you go in the afternoon or when there isn't a show coming up at the civic arts plaza.  It gets absurdly crowded on the weekends and before shows.  Which significantly effects then quality of service.   Best to go in the early afternoon and avoid the rush, if you go at the right time, it's a great priced meal with great service, not too expensive either.

I don't just like or really like but I love the buffalo chicken pizza here. Service is always perfectly fine as far as I know. Can't go wrong with this particular C.P.K. You know, I COULD be a huge pizza snob if I wanted to because my boyfriend is a chef and he makes pizzas from scratch some days and a buffalo chicken pizza even, but the one here at CPK is a guilty pleasure of mine. ;)

Totally unimpressed with the food quality. I think the frozen pizzas labeled "California Pizza Kitchen" in the freezer isle back in Colorado were better than this. Had salad and tacos too, overall way overpriced. This is based on a single experience of carry out, no reason to ever go back again.

This is regarding the service at CPK in Thousand Oaks, CA at The Lakes. My family (4 of us) and I have been frequenting this CPK since it opened. Over the past year, year and a half, the quality at this particular location has declined substantially. We also eat at the following CPK restaurants in Canoga Park, Tarzana, and Encino, as well as the CPK ASAP in Westlake Village.  Just last night (06/04/2011), it started off with the hostess crossing our name off the list when we had not been seated (this added an additional 20 to 30 minutes until we were seated). Finally, after being seated, we placed our order. When we asked for bread, and I am not exaggerating... we were given our four bread/appetizer plates, which came to our table filthy! We asked for new ones, which also came to the table dirty. The third group of 4 plates also came to the table dirty... which at this point, my 14 1/2 year old daughter said "this is disgusting, I am afraid to eat here"! Finally we did receive clean plates. Appetizers were fine. Next came our dinner... my daughter had a full size BBQ chopped salad... upon delivery (not by our waiter, but a different woman), she asked for extra ranch & bbq... the woman never brought it to the table. Once we asked our waiter Ryan, he made 3 trips to the kitchen and back to other tables with water, bread, & drinks before he brought the extra dressing. At the same time the salad was delivered, I received my pizza, which was fine, my son got his pizza, but they made it on the thin crust, when he asked for regular, so that had to be remade. My husband's pizza never arrived. We had to "flag" down our waiter to ask about it. He went to the kitchen and came back and said "the kitchen burned it, and they are remaking it, and both pizzas will be out at the same time". Well, my son's pizza came, which he barely ate, said it was weird tasting. The pizzas DID NOT come out at the same time, but my husband's came about 15 minutes later, as the rest of the family was done eating. My husband's came out on the regular crust when he wanted it on thin crust. At this time, my husband did not even want his pizza. The manager (from the Ventura location), finally came over and apologized. In the end, they only charged us for 2 salads. Big deal... my husband still never ate dinner! We had to pick him up something on our way home at another restaurant!  YES, this was all last night! We have had quite a few similar scenarios at this same location. A few years ago there was a female manager who was terrific! Then this past year, there was a "short" hispanic man who usually had horrible breath and body odor, but otherwise, he was a pretty good manager. We found this offensive as he was in a managerial position. It seems that there has not been a consistent manager at this location and that the service levels are no where near the quality that they are in the other locations listed above.

We've had a number of meals here before.  I wanted to rate this place a while back and couldn't find it, I know know I can add places. It has been hit or miss here.  Mostly we've gotten, the pizza Margharita and Caeser Salad.  The last time we tried the Hamburger Pizza, which was OK, and could have been warmer. Service has always been a downfall here, and usually wait, and then after the food has arrived, getting your server again is like seeing Haley's Comet again in your lifetime. Oh well.  We may or may not be there again, I guess it depends if other family members go there for a birthday or something, but on our own, I think not.
Love the Moroccan Salad.  This restaurant is always clean and friendly.  I know that I can come here and it will be good. No bad surprises here.

CPK has definitely become a reliable restaurant to visit when you have your family together and need a comfortable, no surprises night. The menu has been shifting around lately, but I recommend staying with the old classics (non-thin crust pizzas and salads). The Lakes location is easy enough to access with ample parking, but the service has been hit or miss. Our waiter miscalculated our check 3x, but everyone has bad nights.

My husband loves the Miso Seafood Salad, which is why we went back to CPK tonight. I am a fan of the BLT pizza with whole wheat crust. Tonight, I ordered the crab cakes, which were full of crab (shredded, not lump) and tasty. We also ordered the chicken dumplings for an appetizer and enjoyed those as well. I haven't really had anything bad there, but I don't LOVE anything there either. I usually feel like I spent too much money. As a parent, I have another complaint. Like the other reviewer, it took quite awhile before our server ever came to our table. With a nearly-two-year-old toddler, that is completely unacceptable. She was about ready to climb the walls because she wanted milk and food. Maybe CPK should have runners or bussers who can handle drink orders and bringing the bread to the table if the servers can't get there soon enough.
Great locations, decent menu with good California style pizza, ask for toasted bread as an appy Great servers in this location !!
New Baja Fish Tacos quite tasty!

For people who bought the ice rink/California Pizza Kitchen deal: BEYOND disappointed in CPK today. We had a lovely morning skating with another family today. We went to CPK afterward and asked to sit with our friends at the restaurant. By doing so, the manager would not honor our free kids meals. They considered us "one party" and would only allow two free kids meals. We then said we'd just sit separately then, but she still wouldn't allow it. That is totally unacceptable! Each of our families purchased these deals separately as individual groups. The fact we want to sit together should have been inconsequential. The manager's unwillingness to work with us on this caused her to lose our business today. Instead of giving each family the two free meals promised with our Conejo Deal (totaling maybe $18), they lost the business of two groups totaling probably $100. Be warned, people! Don't make this an excursion you do with friends, as CPK won't honor your Conejo Deal. HUGE mistake on their part! Beyond disappointing!

Today during my lunch at the lakes location I ordered take out, the person on the phone said it would be ready 3:15-3:25. I arrived at 3:30 at the take out side, no one came to help me. I went to the front where the servers were all located and asked for help and a woman with blonde hair said Reuben will be Able to help me. I went back to the take out counter, again waiting.. A few minuets later another associate named Matt asked if I been helped I told him apparently Reuben was going to come to my assistance but again he never came. Finally one of the chef with a white coat assisted me and FINALLY got my order and was very helpful. But the other staff hade waiting while I was in a rush to get my food, I was on my lunch. My food was sloppy and I left very upset, it your chef wasn't there to help me I prob would have been a lot more angry. I felt like the hostess were being very in appropriate when they were off the clock and being a disturbance to the rest of the workers, I assume that's the only reason my order took so long and Reuben never came.

My first visit to this CPK. Service was excellent, the server Ryan was courteous, fast and accurate. It was afternoon (1:00pm) so the place wasn't too crowded Food was great,service was great. What more do you need in a restaurant?

Absolutely TERRIBLE service. WORST restaurant experience EVER. My friends and I went ice-skating, and there were signs everywhere saying "free kids meal after ice skating!" Of course, we were ecstatic. We had some time before the rink opened, so we walked over and sat at the bar. We talked to a waitress by the name of Giovanna, and she told us that we had to spend $10 and we got 2 free kids meals. We didn't have time to order, but we came back after we skated. We came back, and sat in the same spot and saw the same waitress. We ordered one regular pizza, and then two kid pizzas. After the food was delivered and we had began eating, she comes over and says, "Sorry guys, bad news. I was wrong and you only get one kids meal. So you have to pay for the other one." Of course, we were upset. My buddy went, "Why do WE have to pay for your mistake? We wouldn't have ordered this if you hadn't told us." With sass, she said, "Do you wanna speak to my manager?" And obviously we said yes. The female manager came over and tells us she can't do anything, and then walks away. We all look at each other puzzled. Giovanna comes back and tells us we were "lucky" because you have to be 10 or under to get a kids meal. (If that's the case, then why let us order it?) The manager comes back and says once again we are lucky to get one free. I looked down at one of the kiddie pizzas, where I had taken one slice out of it and had one bite. I said, "Do you want this pizza back and then make it free?" She agreed. So she comes back and brings us the check where we only got one pizza for free. Now they tell us we can't get the other one for free because we aren't 10. Meanwhile before they told us we were LUCKY to get that deal. The VERY rude waitress says, "Go ahead and have your mom come and bring you $5. Did you drive your Daddy's beamer here? I didn't go to college to deal with this ****." The manager came back after we tell Giovanna we aren't paying for the pizza. Once again, I ask why we have to pay for THEIR misconception. She tells us too bad and she isn't changing it. Finally the chef comes out and I explain the whole situation. He agrees to give us both pizzas for free. The manager was standing right there and very kindly I look at her and said thank you for your help. Not even looking at me she smirked and just rolled her eyes. ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE. NEVER going to a CPK AGAIN. WHY would you make the CUSTOMER PAY for your mistake? Just because we are 17 made them think they could pull one on us. If we had a parent with us, I'm sure we would have been treated with much more respect. We wouldn't have ordered the stupid pizzas if it wasn't for the waitresses misunderstanding. OH, and my friend was SICK after eating their Hawaiian Pizza. Coincidence?  NEVER go here. RUDE AND DISRESPECTFUL. They do NOT appreciate their customers. Isn't that what the business is all about? Oh, and might I add that the "Manager" had no Name-tag on. And not once did we receive a sorry.
Dewey is an awesome waiter.  Very attentive.  small plate salads and pepperoni pizza and chipotle pizza excellent.  Sat outside 1:30.  Very pleasant.

I like this place. Maybe the pizza is not the best,however, the avocado club rolls are excellent. The cedar plank salmon with the lemon caper spaghettiini is also very wel l done. Cobb Salad is good here too! I do notice now that bread is no longer complimentary anymore unless you ask for it, but for all you yelpers who dis the pizza, my only advice is to try some of the items i mention above. Maybe you'll have a change of heart.
Location is good, food is so-so, staff is friendly but food is overpriced for the quality.

I am giving this CPK three stars because there was nothing spectacular about it. The food was average, which I think is pretty normal for CPK. I didn't expect an amazing experience. What I did expect was for everything to be high in calories. The pizza and pasta are high in calories, but they are comparable to other restaurants, and the salads are lower than I expected. That was a pleasant surprise (though I still got pizza!). I went for a fundraiser for Our Community House of Hope, and so I knew I was going to support a good cause and didn't have extremely high expectations. The server was very nice, but the burner broke or something, which meant that my sister and her boyfriend didn't get their pasta until the rest of us were nearly done with our pizzas. While we didn't really want to get a discount because that would have meant less money to OCHH, they did not even offer something for free or a discount even though we waited a long time, especially for their food. I have no hesitations about going to CPK again, but if I have a choice of CPK or one of the other restaurants, it is likely that I would choose one of the other restaurants. It would also be nice if we could go to any CPK for the fundraisers because there is a CPK a mile from my house.

Anyone who knows me well knows my love of dining out...I swear that if there is a "next life" out there - I'm coming back at as a food critic.  And what a field day I would have had when my office mates & I stopped by CPK for lunch the other day...what a DISASTER! With a chain so tried and true to formula - I almost never miss at CPK.  I've been to locations all over the US - and even patronize the ones at various airports.  And then came CPK at The Lakes.   I'll try to be brief with the highlights: 1.  Bitter hostess - honey - if you don't like your job...get an education and get something better.  I didn't make you work here. 2.  Completely incompetent wait staff.  Once seated, the five of us were literally ignored for the first fifteen minutes - not even water was brought to the table.  When we flagged down a "busy" waitress (picture deer in the headlights here) she was in shock that no one had attended to us and said she'd go right back and find our waiter.  Of course it took another social interaction with the hostess with the mostess to identify our waitress, who then came over to tell us that no one told her she had a table.  "I'm sorry"...would have sufficed. 3.  We ordered food & drinks together - lord knows we're starving at this point.  Water for 3 of us (I know - we're going big), one diet coke and one unsweetened ice tea.  What arrived (another 5 minutes later were five waters, one diet coke and one VERY sweet unsweetened iced tea.  When questioned about the taste of the tea - the wonder waitress mumbled something about how amazing it is that the tea can be so sweet and yet not be sweetened. 4.  Still waiting for food some thirty minutes after ordering, we finally wrangled some bread and butter for the team.  When food arrived, it arrived one plate at a time.  The pasta was cold, as was the one pizza ordered by my colleague.  I carried both dishes back and kindly begged the manager (who was without her name tag on) to assist.  She assured me she would - and nearly ten minutes after the first thirty minutes had passed, we finally all had our food. After a nice little chat with Ms. "Manager" she assured us that she had taken care of our bill.  Not once was there an apology - rather just a routine run down of reasons that service was so slow and so I don't give a damn... We left - full, disappointed and with a pinky swear that we will NEVER come back to this place.  CPK - you may  have something good going as a chain - but this location needs a serious second look.

Wow!  CPK just lost a loyal family of four after our awful dining experience tonight.  My husband and I have loved the wide range of pizza choices for almost 20 years.  Tonight we went to CPK (my choice for my birthday).  We were unpleasantly surprised to see that the new menu allowed about 1/6 of the space to pizza choices with the rest devoted to sandwiches, salads, pastas etc.  My favorite pizza is no longer being offered (garlic chicken) and has been replaced with such offerings as quinoa salad - - seriously!!!  I ordered a new pizza with spinach, cheese, garlic and it was completely lacking in flavor.  My daughter ordered the Margherita and was hard pressed to find any tomatoes or basil.  The coup de grace was the poor service.  CPK messed with a good thing and has now lost our business.

I am a big fan of CPK's in general and went to this one with lot of expectations only to come out disappointed!  - Very Unfriendly, Poor Service. The waitress, her name was Sandra seemed as if she didnt like doing the job at all - Tasteless Food: I usually like the food at other CPKs but this one was really worst.  - Hugeeee DELAY. I observed this delay even at other CPK's. The servers keep running around and you will see all other servers except your one. The food will take forever to arrive The ambience looks good and is neat but the service, food quality and delay really SUCKS. They need to give a serious thought about the people working there and change 90% of them.

I went to lunch with my boss at this CPK we told our server we only had 1 hr. for lunch...he didn't seem to care! it took forever to get our meal and our check! This is a great location but with this poor service this place wont' be here long. I for one will not be going back there.

I love the 1/2 salads here! My favorite is the Thai Crunch. Staff is always polite and accommodating. The only thing I'm not really a fan of is the bread they bring out (sometimes). It looks, feels, and tastes like they just pulled it out of a bag from Vons. It would do wonders just to warm it up. Other than that, I really like this place!

By the looks of the other reviews, I can see that I am not the only person that has had a poor experience at the TO CPK. We went last Saturday, late afternoon. It was not busy at all. They started to seat us right next to the door, but we have been seated there before and you have to hold on to everything everytime they come in or out. So they seated us towards the back...BIG MISTAKE - out of sight, out of mind. Service was awful...a.w.f.u.l. We had to ask for everything...every time. At one point, we spilled a full glass of water. We had to go behind the counter to get a rag and clean it up ourselves...our waitress never even knew it happened.  At various times, we would ask someone that walked by for help...NEVER happened. We ordered our food...and when it finally came (over 40 minutes for the 5 of us), one pizza was luke warm (obviously had been sitting around), and my salad appeared to have been made with lettuce that had been frozen..kind of wimpy, soggy, and transparent.  We typically like CPK, but I think we will go next door to PF Changs or Claim Jumper next time we are in town. I am sure they will welcome the business.
The food was very delicious and service was very fast. You should ask for Dave because he is amazing! Great service and recommendations! Thank you Dave.

I am sitting here with my son and this place is packed with families of dancers who perform at the TO civic art plaza. DAVE my server is literally running and taking care of just about half the restaurant and not missing a beat. Slower service has been my only complaint here but Dave has upped the ante today.  Dave, thanks for your hard work and great service! CPK you might want to keep this guy around!!

How is this place still open...???  This might be one of the most mismanaged restaurants in the area.  The front host kaylie has literally no clue what she's doing, the manager on duty was just as confused.  My order took 28 mins to get (lunch item) the waiter said "sorry not my fault as he dropped the check and food off at the same time.  This place better get it together or I fear they won't last much longer.

I've been going to CPK for over 25 years and I must say it hasn't been as often the last few years.  Maybe 3 time a year we make it to one.  This has been our main location since it opened and it seems each time I go in, they have a "new" look and a different menu.  We walked in around 7:30 on Friday night and we were seated right away because the restaurant was half full.  I remember the days waiting over 45 minutes at that time.  Our server came up to us approximately 5 minutes after we sat down because the four of us were able to decide what we wanted. We ordered our drinks and entrees at the same time.  We stated that 2 of us were splitting a salad and and entree as were the other two.  She asked us if we wanted bread for the table and of course we said yes. About 5 minutes later she brings our drinks and about 10 minutes after that she arrives with our entrees.  We asked her what about our salads, which you would assume would come out before the entrees, she asked, "so you want me to send these back?"  Yes and please bring our salads.  She went and retrieved our salads, and of course we had to ask for utensils and extra plates to share.  She rolled her eyes and hurried off to get what we needed. When she returned she asked if we wanted ground pepper and I answered yes.  I served up the salads and everyone started to eat their salad.  I waited and waited for the pepper and I decided to start of my salad since I thought she forgot about it.  A few minutes later I saw her walking by with a tray of drinks for another table and then she came back to ours to offer the pepper.  As we were almost finished with our salads, she arrives with the bread she offered. Our entrees came and she brought extra plates which was nice since we were sharing, but then a few minutes later she arrives again with more plates and seemed confused that we already had plates. What really blew my mind was as we were looking over the bill, the server came by to clear my wife's plate in front of her and she placed a dirty plate that she cleared from another table on top of my wife's plate and cleared it.  I have NEVER seen that before was totally turned off by her actions. This is not the same CPK I have been going to.  Their prices are much higher and the portions are noticeably smaller.  I saw a manager walking around once, but that was it.  It seems that they are cutting back on staff, management and portions.  Very sad and I'm not sure if I will be back!

Second time here, well almost. Both Times I ordered a single pizza. First time was great. Made me want to come back. Today, not so much.  Both times I ordered over the phone. After the dozens of questions from my name to would you like an iced tea,  would you like napkins, would you like anything else to drink besides tea, would you like free bread, would you like to join our pizza rewards program, all these questions but today when I arrived there was nobody at that to go counter to greet me or asked have I  been helped. I came at the target time I was told over the phone. The restaurant was completely empty. There were more employees sitting at tables on their break then there were customers. I waited 15 minutes passed my target time that I was quoted, with still not even a hello or have you been helped. So I just left, I don't want pizza anymore.  Zero stars for today's visit, four stars for my first visit equals this two star review.
Great food and service. I ordered the Halibut and it just melted in my mouth. The service was excellent, fast and friendly. The wait wasn't too bad. The Chicken was moist and flavorful.

We got the garlic chicken pizza and if you don't like onions too much then ask for just a little on your pizza cause they put a ton. We had a WONDERFUL waiter, Derek. Super funny and if you can get a table in his section then don't miss out! We also got dessert and it was very delicious. Calm environment.. we will definitely be back soon.

I ordered the California club with chicken for take on my lunch break. Worst chicken club sandwich I've ever had. There was like 4 little tiny cut up pieces of chicken that were so small I couldn't even tell there was chicken in it. Like you have to try really hard to put that little amount of chicken. Splattered with way too much mayo, and the bread was dry and way too thick, ended up taking off the top layer of bread and wiping off as much mustard as I could with it. Worst lunch I've had in a long long time.

Loved their new cauliflower buffalo appetizer!! I dying to have it again. Large group of us ladies and they were quick to get us in and service was great. Great bread and olive oil to start. Looking forward to returning

I've been here a couple times in past few months, and I've been disappointed both times. The food left me wishing I'd ordered something else. Things sound good on the menu, but the execution is poor. For example, the shrimp scampi zucchini tonight lacked any flavor and the shrimp was overcooked.   The servers are friendly, but the overall operation seems disorganized. They have a huge wait staff with many hosts and servers walking around empty handed, but the service was still quite slow. The Sedona tortilla soup is consistently very good, though!

Consistently good food. Staff is friendly and efficient. Great places to bring kids! My daughter is under 2 and enjoys coloring the kids menu and the options for her to eat are great- fruit, chicken dishes, pasta, pizza, and dessert. Plus it's not just one kind of pasta or one pizza- you get OPTIONS! Which I love! Not a typical kids menu.  Love their new bread while you wait. I love their BBQ chicken pizza and strawberry shortcake dessert.

We should have ordered pizza.  I had the Pesto Cream Penne, which was pretty good! Definitely better than my boyfriends meal. He got the ribeye, and a word he used to describe it was "boring." And mediocre. Ordered it medium rare, but it was a little more on the rare side and tasted like nothing. They had some butter on top and if there had been more it would have been better, but probably still as bland. The side potatoes were also pretty bland and a little undercooked.  We went tonight since we had a gift card, and we would probably only return if we were given another one.

This place has really changed. I used to come here all the time with my family. Every time we came there was a wait, there were more families and children, and it had a much better vibe. I came here with my boyfriend a few days ago and for a Friday evening it was a ghost town. We were immediately seated and our waitress was very very kind. We ordered drinks, the strawberry lime margarita was delish! We also ordered an appetizer, just chips and guacamole. We got the dish and it was literally 8 unsalted chips and the guacamole wasn't blended, it was tiny bits of chopped avocado in a tiny pretty pile topped with black beans. (Eh at least it was only 4.99, you get what you pay for). We ordered 'The Works' pizza. When we received the pizza we were a little surprised. It was much smaller and the bread was super super thin, the chip was thicker. We took a bite and my boyfriend immediately spit it out. There was barely any cheese! Maybe a few little shavings. TONS of bell pepper and a few chunks of sausage that was dry. We were very disappointed. This used to be our go to, and now we won't be back. Sad to see my childhood restaurant where it is now.

Came here for Veteran's Day and it was a fantastic experience.  Both my brother and I received free pizzas and they were most delicious.  The service was great (Michael) and he even left us a personal note thanking us for our service.  Completely changed my opinion of this chain for the better.

Tonight was as good as it gets.  Our food server (Rosa) was right on top of everything.   The menu looked a little different to me but I asked her opinion starting with drink menu.  She was spot on.  It was delightful.  Had shrimp scampi that had sliced zucchini and pasta.  It was heavenly.  Then came dessert.  Had a carmel pudding.  Their ability to make gluten free pizza made my daughter in law happy.  It was the perfect evening thanks to terrific service and excellent food.  Thank you CPK.  I will be back.

Simply a bad experience. Early Sunday evening and clearly understaffed. More than 10 minutes to get cocktails. Pea soup arrived as though the cup was used as a scoop. Cold too.  The rest of the food was good but the service was just awful. Server and manager were unfortunate.

Big thank you to the team at CPK and especially our server, Chris! Great food and wonderful, friendly service. Chris shared his inspiring story and gave us a lunch we will never forget! Thanks again from your crazy Italian friends and the centennial :)

We decided to give this place another go...we ordered the same thing - chicken milanese. The breading that's normally on it is nice crispy with a layer of arugula & tomato salad on top with a light dressing.  The chicken with breading was soggy & hardly any salad dressing.   This place has definitely gone down in their quality of food and service. What happened?!  Their regular staff is all gone! We use to love this place!!!

Disappointed to say the least.  I ate lunch here on 8-23, was seated right away, server got me set up with water & took my order, checked back regularly.  No problem with service.  But what happened on the food end?  I ordered the lunch special, 1/2 turkey club with quinoa salad.  Salad was great, but not given enough dressing to coat the salad. The turkey club, while good tasting, had 1 piece of turkey and 3 to 4 leaves of lettuce.  I didn't need another salad!  I've had this same lunch at the Tarzana location many times and it was perfect.  Not sure if you have someone new in the kitchen or you've just reduced your sandwiches to 1 piece of meat, but for over $9 you should get more than bread & lettuce. I took a photo, but don't see a way to post it.
Every time I've came here for lunch, we've had great service. Food is always delicious and very affordable for such a good portion size. Love their menu options and their lunch combo specials.
One of the worst experiences, when you are a vegetarian and order a vegetarian salad and suddenly find you are chewing on bacon fat!!! I'll never go there again!

Our second visit was even better than our last. We lucked out again and got seated in Caroline's section. She is so energetic and makes you feel like family. Great time, good energy, good wine list and very good value.

Our meal on theater night started out fine and quickly went downhill. We were seated and gave our orders and waited and waited and waited and when the food finally arrived it came to the table piece meal as well as looking as if it were hastily prepared. All of that set aside, what made it a truly lousy meal worth yelping about was how the fish was butchered and then cooked it until every bit of moisture was effectively removed and one felt as if they were eating fish jerky. If it were one fish dish alone ok we get it but two identical messed up fish dishes is enough to make us think about not returning for a long long time. There were 4 of us and the only redeeming quality of the meal was the server actually hearing our complaint and adjusting the bill accordingly. When you look forward to going out to dinner, dinner shouldn't be as disappointing as this meal was.

I used to come to cpk all the time and LOVED it. I haven't been in months so I decided to go for lunch today and was pretty disappointed with my visit. The food was great but it was the service that made my visit unenjoyable. Our waitress was not friendly and she managed to spill water all over the floor right by our booth while refilling our glasses. I work in a restaurant so I know spills happen and that's completely okay but she did not even clean it up. The water sat on the floor the whole time we ate and was still there when we got up. Hopefully next visit will be better because I love the food!

Celebrating my girlfriends sons 15th birthday. We probably had the BEST waiter that I have ever been around. All you need to know is CHRIS HAYNES. The best waiter in the business. He introduces himself, constantly checks on us to see if we are good and thanked is at the end of the evening. Gave a gift card to Matt (birthday boy). Truly an amazing person!!!

I come here all the time and u love the food and the staff is great. Today was my first time doing pick up in the rain. The food was ready super fast and the person that ran it out to my car was super quick.  Defiantly going back many many more times!!!
This place is very quite and nice. The food is really tasty. I would recommend the rib eye steak or the salmon pasta.

Love having lunch here when visiting The Lakes for kids events. The salads are always delicious and thin crust pizzas are yummy. Never had any bad experience with staff. They were always courteous and attentive.  This place is kid friendly too. Location is great especially when the weather is nice, outside seating recommended. I wish they have WiFi though.

Had not gone to a CPK in many years, but had remembered enjoying the bbq chicken chopped salad and bbq chicken pizza.  My wife always remembered it as being quite awful, but she reluctantly agreed to join me for lunch here today.  Unfortunately, the experience was quite horrible.  We won't be going back.   The most glaring problem is the quality (or more appropriately, the lack thereof) of the food.  We ordered a salad, flat bread, and and ice tea.  The quality of the ingredients in the salad was horrible.  When the spinach / mushroom flat bread arrived, it was cold as ice.  We had them replace it with a hot one accordingly, which tasted alright.  However, the salad was so awful, my wife couldn't even eat more than a few bites of her portion.   The restaurant is managed poorly as they do not keep up with the bussing or cleaning up of trash off of the tables.  Our server was trying hard to please (and would clean up the table when we requested it), but clearly did not have the training or intuition needed to be a quality server.  She brought the pitcher of iced tea over to fill up my empty glass, and poured it full of the tea, minus any ice.  There wasn't any ice in the pitcher, but she clearly didn't recognize that this was a problem on her own.  There were so many other glaring details in the service and quality of the food that were missing.  It's clear that this chain has seen better days.  At $28 for the salad, bread, and an ice tea, this is an incredibly poor value.   We will not be going back to CPK ever again.  I usually don't wish ill-will upon a business (particularly those in my own community), but this one is so bad, that I do hope that they go out of business and ultimately get relaced by a stronger dining establishment.  Oh how I wish we would get a California Chicken Cafe out here in Westlake Village.   There, you can get a similar meal (having much higher quality ingredients) for about $18.   My strong recommendation is to avoid CPK and instead to go to the Stonefire Grill, less than a mile east down Thousand Oaks Blvd..  The differences in the quality of the food, and overall experience between the two is night and day.  One (Stonefire) is managed and run extremely well.  The other (CPK) is stuck in the 80's and clearly trying to maximize its profits with crappy quality food at ridiculous prices.  CPK either needs to entirely revamp its approach to food and service, or needs to go out of business.

This CPK was the best that I've ever been to. The outdoor space was perfect for a brisk November day. The waitstaff was superb as well. Tara, greeted me super kindly and Michael was probably the best server I've had in all of my dining experiences - one of the cutest for sure :). It was nice to have Amir the general manager come and greet as well!  Can't wait to try this place again!

foos is always good.. but do not order over the phone if you are in a hurry. ive placed large orders twice and apparently a call center handles the phone orders- communication is lacking. These are business lunches so it makes me look bad when i'm late due to miscommunication on CPK's part. I will discourage my clients from chosing CPK when im bringing them lunch.

the lady never gave us bread or my very thirsty friend a Coke refill. she placed us in a very annoying sector of the establishment. I do not know how I could force myself into coming to this mockery again. I wish I liked it because the food was superb but the lady who served us was way less than adequate.
Food is good.  Service is really nice.  Our server is SUPER BUSY!  But constantly checks in patiently.  Good place to come with the teens - pasta, pizza & salads.

Had not been here  for a while. They changed the inside and have a new menu. Ordered lobster flatbread which was very good and chopped Italian salad. It was good but they changed the dressing. Noticed they have steak on the menu which cost 25.99. Will stick with pizza and salad.

Went out for dinner & ordered the Sweet Deal for two $32.00; Share an appetizer, two entrees (pizza & Garlic chicken pasta); share a dessert. The waitress took our order; asked if we wanted bread. She never brought it until we asked for it again. We then were brought our appetizer with the bread. We were brought our pasta without the chicken. When we told her she had said that we had to order it separately. We had to show her the menu! With that she told us that she needed to tell the manager; who came over to us to tell us that they were making it for us. By then, she or he should have told us that they were taking it off our check! This waitress never went out of her way for us-refilling our drinks. We told her that we wanted to have our  dessert packed to g. Well, that took about 15 minutes! I then went to the manager to complain. He then told us that he would take care of our check. It's too bad that my husband felt bad for the waitress & left her  a tip; which she did not deserve! Guess California Pizza Kitchen won't be seeing me ever again!

I really enjoyed the last CPK that I went to but this one was just okay. I ordered the Thai salad. There were about four pieces of chicken in the whole thing. I didn't like the dressing either. The salads are huge but mostly was all lettuce. My daughter loves the chopped salad. We shared the Secret Menu Garlic Chicken White Pizza. It was okay, nothing worth keeping a secret for.

The BEST in my opinion.   Funny thing I came here years ago and after multiple visits it was very poor.  Bad service bad food just awful. I stopped coming here.  A friend took me last year wow. NOW IT is different. Not sure what happened last year with cpk but its clean fast and great food.  Managers always there. All are nice. The main manager Amer is great. Very hot too :)  I come in 3 times a week. Best cpk anywhere  Tammy

This place used to be managed very well but now its a complete DISASTER. The pizza tasted homemade but not in a good way-  thick cheese clumped with a greesy film on top-YUCK! Will never come back to this location again. I waited forever for horrible food. Service was horrible and food was worse. MANAGEMENT MANAGEMENT MANAGEMENT.
Love this place I go here all the time, and for a pizza place, they have the best salmon. Superb

CPK Thousand Oaks is the worst because they are unable to get there act together on there " to go" orders . The first time I ordered pick up , they gave me the wrong dressing and it was half full for a full salad . The second time I ordered a chopped salad full and when I got home it was smaller than a half . I brought it back to the restaurant and the girl at the" to go "counter told me that , that was the portion of a full , and another server came up and said it didn't even look like a complete order . She didn't even know her portions. The manager told me that this wasn't a full salad ( which I already knew ) and kept interrupting me when I spoke I WILL NEVER GO BACK. I think they cheat the people on portions for the " to go" orders to save money because they know most people won't take the time to bring back the order .

It's funny how a single bad experience will keep a diner away, well, pretty much forever. I never gave it much thought but about 20 years ago I had a not so positive experience at a California Pizza Kitchen restaurant in Studio City (didn't care for the food), and this has kept me away from CPK since then. I received a gift card for the restaurant a few months ago and was planning on passing it on but decided to use it and was pleasantly surprised. Great pizza!! Also had roasted veg salad, it was ok... nothing great. But again - awesome pizza and fantastic service as well. Will return.

Great for families and kids parties.  Food is fine and prices a bargain.    Has at kids parties here several times and with them for after sports lunches.   They are very accommodating to families.  Not a place for a date in my view.

CPK is one of those chains that started off great and is now becoming a corporate , money hungry business that only hires people who do not give a crap about their jobs and should not be in customer service. The managers at this location are rude, unhelpful, and are only concerned about upping sales. The last time we ate here, my mother asked for her chicken on her salad to be made fresh, not pre-marinated with garlic, because she is ALLERGIC and the manger was so rude and refused even though with pervious managers they agreed to do it with no extra charge. He only agreed to do it "one time only" after my father came into the restaurant and he backed down because my dad is a tall, 6 foot tall, intimidating guy. This specific CPK is not the only location that refuses to help with special orders. The fact that a restaurant refuses to make FRESH chicken that does not have bull shit sprinkled on it is disgusting. Pre-marinated, mass produced food is what is making the American people obese. In addition, the service is hit or miss. Once again, that comes down to management. When you have a bad manager, servers do not care about their service because they are not treated well in return.

I have always enjoyed CPK and been impressed with their service. I recently discovered this specific locations Curb Side Pick up and received my meals that way. The last few times tho, even after confirming my order was correct when making it over the phone, there has been a few issues. When I've picked my order up and taken it home, the order has been wrong. This happened a few times but I never said anything. A few days ago, I made an order over the phone to pick it up at Curbside and the lady that took my order confirmed everything with me twice and then told me the total at the end upon request. When I went to pick it up, the employee that brought out my order gave me a different total that was more than what the previous total that was told to me was. When I told the server he just apologized and took my card. Even though he sensed my frustration he didn't offer to compensate me for the mistake. In my opinion, when your told one thing with an order, especially the price. You don't go back on the original price your told. What if I only brought that exact amount and couldn't pay for the rest of my order? Times are hard financially and I asked the grand total in advance for a reason. After I got home and took out my order, on top of it the order was missing specific things that I confirmed with the person that took my order and reassured me nothing would be forgotten. It for sure didn't seem worth the extra dollars that I really could afford to spare. If I knew that the total was a little more than I had expected, I would have taken something out before they made everything I wanted. I love CPK but the past few times the experience has not been as enjoyable as I hoped.
Our waitress, Ashley Jean, was awesome!!! Great service and will definitely come back because of her :) my drink was never empty and she made sure we were satisfied

Very nice, outdoor patio seating but needs more shade umbrellas, many tables were in direct sun so we sat inside.  The waiter was very attentive: we were there mid afternoon and I guess his indoor tables were not as popular... so he checked on us about every two minutes, which can get annoying. The tortilla chips tasted a little old, but the lemonade comes in many flavor, and was raved about by my companions. I saw some questionable sanitary practices among staff (not our overly attentive waiter).

I like CPK. i love the food and service is usually great but tonight...Wow, I cannot believe that server. Yes, I'm talking about you, green shirt guy. We ordered dumplings for an appetizer and when he came by to drop them off, he said so in an accent (a shoddy attempt at an Asian one) and walked away to the table over and just continued on in plain ENGLISH, zero accent. WTH? Yes, I'm Asian but it's not funny or cute and I'm offended. CPK's food is great. I love their pizzas and drinks. But, you can't have great food without great service. That's what truly makes a restaurant experience enjoyble and tonight was lacking in tact, respect, and mindfulness.

Well, first off, I want to say the service was good and our waitress was very pleasant. Thus 2 stars. Apart from that, the food was a big disappointment. My daughter has been a fan of CPK since she was in high school and she is now a grown woman.  She, too, was disappointed. i ordered the Chinese Chicken salad and it looked like the leftovers from a wild frat party after they got sick.  Lettuce was wilted and sparse and the ginger in the dressing was overly pronounced. My daughter  ordered some new Thai salad that also looked like it was tired.  In CPK's defense, the bread and olive oil dip was very good.  I was also surprised at the size of the portions Very stingy.  .  I am going to go and order a good Chinese Chicken salad from a restaurant that I know has a decent one and send photo to the manager.  Mine wasn't anything like most salads of that kind.

Ugh, CPK... Why offer thin crust if you can't get it right?  One thing I tend to like about the 'upscale' chains is that they tend to be good about getting the basics right. Even if everything else falls short, usually the basics of the cuisine tend to be there. CPK fails in this respect, as when my boyfriend and I both ordered thin crust pizzas, they both came back just slightly thinner than your standard pizza. Look, it's simple. Either roll out your dough thinner, get a sheeter than has a thinner setting, stretch out the damn pizza dough by hand or DON'T offer effing thin crust pizza. Worse, kick your ovens up a couple hundred degrees and at least trick me into thinking I'm eating thin crust pizza with a crunch on the bottom. Soggy pizza crust just doesn't do it for me and as a matter of fact, it rather pisses me off.  My toppings were good though. I forgot what I ordered something with a butt load of onions, artichoke hearts and salami and that was good. They didn't skimp on the artichoke hearts so my experience wasn't that terrible. I didn't try my boyfriend's pizza but he seemed to like his enough to not complain.  What does suck about CPK is their beer menu. C'mon, this chain is doing really well even in these hard times. How's about getting more beer on tap than just Budweiser or Coors? The best beer in a bottle available is Heineken. Now that's just embarrassing. Get it together, CPK. You guys are well funded. Figure it out.

My husband and I eat at least once a week at the CPK in Thousand Oaks. Their management and wait staff are superior to other local restaurants. They are consistently professional, friendly, engaging and demonstrate a very high level of personal interest in how your meal and your entire experience  turns out.  Their menu options are nicely varied and the quality and quantity of the food is excellent. So many chain restaurants rely heavily on salt and sugar to appeal to peoples' desire for a tasty meal. I have to say that CPK seasons their food perfectly and uses salt and sugar very judiciously so that I would describe their food as really well-prepared and healthy, substantial but elegant comfort food.  In particular I want to single out Emily, one of the TO store managers. She demonstrates the ideal qualities of a genuine, engaging, warm personality and a strong desire to help out her team to make sure that the customer gets exactly what s/he wants. She is an incredible asset to the restaurant.  When one small issue cropped during a visit, the general manager, Amir, stepped up to make sure we knew he was addressing our concerns, going above and beyond what we could have ever expected to make sure we were taken care of. He let us know in several ways how much our opinions and experiences mattered to him and that every single concern and suggestion was going to be included in his team management meeting. This is our first go-to restaurant in T.O. The food, service, atmosphere are outstanding.

The service is awful! I ate here at 1:00 pm on a Monday and the restaurant was only 1/4 full. No refills on drinks from the server unless you find her and ask. Not clearing plates from first course while you eat 2nd course. Actually, she presented the check and all the dishes are still sitting on the table (1st and 2nd course) Not friendly service or common courtesies. The management does a poor job of training their employees. I looked at the calories on the special menu of calories and the food is high in salt and calories. I will not be eating here again. Better food and service elsewhere in town.

I always like CPK.  They are consistent in quality, quantity and promptness!  We always get the Thai Crunch salad and then choose a different pizza every time.  This visit, we had the Tostada Pizza.  It was delightful, with beans, lettuce, tortilla strips and sour cream drizzled on top.  We added the Lime Chicken for added pizzaz and it was great.  Nice lunchtime date with my co-worker, Kate!

Loved sitting outside on this just right weather day eating a very early dinner.  Looking at the little pond and park like setting was very nice.  Service was excellent!  4 cheese ravoli with mushrooms was spot on, as was the artichoke and spinach pizza. Thanks too for letting the Newbury park High School Orchestra perform on your patio.  Very enjoyable all around!
Ashley J at T.O CPK was very professional and kind . She explained every detail of a few items off of menu and her suggestions was everything she said it would be.

I met my family for lunch since it's close to my office and my girls are on their summer break.  After ordering our food, we realize that the music was way up and couldn't hardly have a conversation.  I politely asked one of the staff members if it is possible to turn down the volume.  Guess what?  they did!  I've requested at a different restrauant once before and they said, 'I will see what I can do' and didn't even bother.

This review with two stars is solely on the poor performance of the manager on duty... Went for lunch on Saturday the 26.... 1:30pm. Not only was it busy but the line of people waiting just to check in was out the door. Only one hostess on duty at prime lunch time on a Saturday....  The manager on duty walked by the front several times and saw all of us waiting because the poor hostess was overly busy trying to seat everyone she could. At no point did the manager ever acknowledge any of us or make any effort to say, "sorry for the wait" or make an effort to help the hostess seat or take names. And we watched him doing nothing but stand at a computer and watch the floor the entire time. After we finally got seated, during our lunch, we watched him at the kitchen buttoning and retucking in his shirt! In the kitchen area, in sight of many patrons eating. Completely unprofessional and dissapointing. I haven't been to cpk in a long time. I always remembered being great. This time, it was just ok. Nothing fabulous, but nothing overly great either.
Worst service. Food was delivered cold. They couldn't get the outside heaters to work.

I was very upset with the service when I made a phone order to CPK. The woman on the phone greeted me very rudely. She made me repeat my order multiple times. When i misheard her and asked her to clarify she repeated herself in a very annoyed tone. Also, considering I'm a vegan, I asked her if the dish I was ordering was vegan. She said CPK didn't classify if things were vegan or not, which was understandable. But when I asked her if she could ask the chef if there was any dairy or animal products all she said was, "there isn't any meat." Also she told me I couldn't make 2 separate orders over the phone which didn't make sense. I was very unhappy with her whole attitude towards me, since I am a paying customer giving cpk service.

I was sorely disappointed at my last visit to the California Pizza Kitchen here in Thousand Oaks. They offered me the bigger flat pizza versus the regular size. My husband and I went for the thinner crust larger pizza. His pizza because had artichoke hearts on it and such was so uninteresting and bland that I would have sent it back. He did not. Mine which had to jerk chicken on it was better but still it was a very disappointing pizza. They should not offer that flat larger pizza because they add nothing to the cover the larger area. So, it ends up being a larger pizza which is sparsely covered & flavored. There is practically nothing on the pizza itself. A regular-sized pizza probably would have been better. But, still in all the food was not very interesting or very good I would not recommend this restaurant and I will not go back. The high point of the meal was the ECCO Domani white wine recommended by the waiter which I found fabulously wonderful. Too bad. I used to love California Pizza Kitchen.

Kinda surprised at some of the reviews here.  This is one of the best CPK's I've been to.  The dining area is nice & cozy with mostly booths.  I thought the service was fine.  I had the arugula salad and a thin crust wild mushroom pizza...both were delicious.  I will be going again.

I really like their Italian meat thin crust pizza well done.  They also had this dessert that was super good, recommended by the waitress.  Some sort of soft cake with vanilla ice cream, sorry I cannot remember the name.

Great exspericence!! The food was terrific! Had the Cali fields salad and white corn guacamole! Both were incredible and our waitress, Ashley Jean, was super friendly and nice to my little brother and I, even sugested a few drinks, which were really good as well!

I phoned in a pickup order at 7:41 & ordered soup & a pizza. The guy on the phone said he'd give napkins & bread with the soup. He also said the order would be ready at 7:53. I showed up curbside at 7:59 to pick it up & had to wait 10minutes for someone to come out. I didn't think it was a big deal but I opened my bag & there was just soup. No napkins or bread. I decided to eat my pizza first but is was cold. Like it had just been taken out of the refrigerator.
