I had only driven for 1 block before parking & checking my food so not enough time would've passed for my food to get cold. The crust was huge & hurt my jaw just from chewing 1 slice. Not up to standards for this type of establishment.
The service was excellent! I ordered the original BBQ chicken pizza and it was exactly as I wanted it to be. The only reason it is not perfect five is because the lemonade was very sour!
Service was good. Have to say that i didint try the pizza had the steak and it waa amazing it just came aftet a little while could of been a bit faster
They have amazing food speichely the pizza with feta cheese i defiantly recommended to go visit there and i will come back to eat there many times

Went on a midday Saturday when it was surprisingly slow maybe 20 other people and service was kind of appalling to be honest. They got my order wrong after explicitly saying the way I needed it because of an allergy; the drink was then also wrong. When the server came to collect my card there was no interaction with her asking how the food was or how we were doing, the only thing she asked is if we were ready for dessert. The server was egregiously unequipped for a position in the service industry as she didn't seem to even care how she interacted with us. Do not recommend going here, I for one will not ever be returning, it was just unacceptable as far as basic service goes.

I met up with my mom, aunts, and girl cousins at CPK at The Lakes for a birthday lunch today.  It was my first time hearing of or seeing The Lakes dining and shopping area and I think it is really nice.  Water features with a little bridge, sculptures of children playing, and a small play area.  Tommy Bahama, PF Chang's, and Claim Jumper, and a few other stores all right next to the Civic Arts Plaza. Anyhow, I was nursing a minor headache from drinking last night and ordered a raspberry lemon drop martini (hair of the dog, right?).  God bless a lunch location with a full bar.  Between the 8 of us we had a nice variety of salads, pizzas, and I went with the Italian Sandwich with Caesar salad.  All of our lunches were great!  They also brought out an ice cream sundae with a candle for my aunt.  Recommend!
food used to be a lot better, service was eh waited about 15 minutes in the drive up lane...

I so wished I could write a positive review since I love the location but the food and service was MISERABLE.  It was an early family dinner with two kids under 6, including a very hungry toddler. Although everything started well, we were sat promptly and the drink order was taken right away.  And then everything started going south.  The bread we requested never came until the appetizers were brought out.  Then the food order came out with two wrong dishes.  Although one was fixed, the second and most important for the toddler had to be made again.  The waitress said it would be taken off the bill and brought out right away.  After waiting another 10 minutes it was brought out but the pasta sauce was still wrong (we just ordered fettucini alfredo) so they had to remake it yet again.  At this point my son was over it since it was going on 20 over minutes and we had all finished our food at this point (which he didn't want to partake in).  After asking for the bill so we could just take everyone home since full meltdown had started, I realized we were still charged for the dish and asked what had happened.  Waitress then said taking food was up to manager discretion and i said ok that is not what had been said earlier.  So she stepped away to find manager I assume but after waiting another 10 minutes we simply had to leave.  Very disappointed especially since this location messages being family friendly.  Not if you want an unhappy family with hungry kids.
Good value, menu was well thought out. We had Flat bread, soup and salad all tasted good.

I can't say enough about how much I like this restaurant. 1. The kids meals offered are healthy! I order my kids grilled chicken breast with broccoli and homemade Mac n cheese with edamame on the side.  2. The kids meals are SO cheap compared to other restaurants and the quality is high and consistent.  3. Staff is FANTASTIC! Our favorite servers know us by name and make us all feel so welcome. 4. Management is always kind and present. The GM and assistant GM are usually there greeting customers with a smile and making sure everyone is happy.  5. Location is perfect if you have kids. This CPK is located at the lakes in TO so if you have kids you can eat outside and let them play on the playground until your food arrives.  6. I could go on and on but I am sure you get the point by now...LOVE IT!

You can't go wrong with CPK, but this location has exceptional service,  our server Dave was amazing and really went out of his way to show us a good time. Kudos to the staff here especially Dave who made our experience a very positive one. Customer service at its best!
I am sad to write a bad review but their service has gone way down hill. long wait times for the food and food was not as good as it use to be. I wont be coming back to this CPK again.

First I'm going to say that this review has nothing to do with the actual Thousand Oaks location and the taste of the food or service. I have been coming to Thousand Oaks for many many years and the food is always amazing as well as the service. Yesterday I dined in for lunch with myself and 3 others. We ordered 2 salads, and 2 pizzas. A couple of drinks and the bill was $82. I noticed that both the pizzas and salads went up in price and the salad portion is noticeably different. Is also noticed that the portion of oil in their dipping oil has also gone down. Something so minor, yet so noticeable. I know all restaurants are doing what they need to do right now, but the full size of the salads really got a lot smaller, especially with using a different bowl now instead of a plate. I just think that if you lower the portion size, then why do you need to raise the price by 1-2 dollars each item. I really love Cpk but I don't think any lunch is worth $82 for some salad and pizza...

Yet another lunch at CPK, and strangely enough the service was slow from being seated to being waited on etc. We asked one of the employees for help and he took our drink order and brought us a server along with offering us a free appetizer (which we declined)...the server was sweet (Gracie) and attentive and during the course of our meal we were attended to by nearly everybody in the restaurant. Then when our lunch arrived the first employee we spoke to stated that lunch was on him....he turns out to be the General Manager (Amir K). He was generous, very concerned about our dining experience and Gracious too. He took an ordinary situation and made it extraordinary. His genuine concern for us is refreshing in a world where more and more people take no pride in their work or business. He is a credit to CPK and though we still would have come back to the restaurant before his generosity, we will come back knowing that they really DO care about their customers at CPK!

With so many other restaurants in the area service is something that is a determining factor on if I keep going back to a restaurant.  CPK is not somewhere I will choose to spend my money in the future.  I have been to many CPK locations and the food is always decent which it was at this location too but in two different visits my order was incorrect (simply a no onion change each time).  I understand that things happen but it is how staff reacts that makes the difference. When my pizza was wrong the server admitted it and took it back to get the correct one made but my food did not come out until the rest of the party (5 people) was finished eating.  There was no urgency to get the pizza to me quickly to correct the error.  The second time we had ordered take out so there was no change that could be made.  The service both for takeout and dining was lacking and slow.  We will spend out money at one of the many other TO restaurants from now on.

I loved the artichoke dip, I had a south western soup because I'm a vegetarian, it wasn't bad at all, maybe a little bland tasting after eating on it for a while, the vegetable pizza with the blue cheese was nice if you like savoury and sweet. But if I went back I would probably just get two orders of the artichoke dip and chips, just for a satisfying finish or try something new.Yum.
My hats off to the Thousand Oaks California Pizza Kitchen for treating me to the best Veterans Day meal I've ever had.  Job well done! Thank you, Dan Smee Habanero Carnita Pizza the best!

The service at this place is always amazing. And i always order either a bbq chicken chopped salad, italian chopped salad, or the bbq chicken pizza and i must say they are all very good options; but they just aren't amazing! Plus it is a little over price for what they actually sell you! But this place is a fast grab for lunch during the week and the salads are always fresh. I think it is a good restaurant, go check it out!
Beautiful location!! Excellent service by Kellian!!! Delicious food!!!! Plenty of parking!!!

Oh, the irony.  Given the name of this establishment, I expected at least somewhat decent pizza.  I have been to other CPKs, but oh my goodness, the pizza here was awful, just awful.   My regretful meal consisted of: CALIFORNIA CLUB PIZZA = don't be fooled by how pretty this looks in the photo I took.  The lettuce/tomato/avocado appeared to be promising toppings, but this was all a facade to conceal the sad truth underneath: scant amount of bacon, didn't find any chicken, and THE CRUST WAS SO TOUGH AND CHEWY LIKE LEATHER.  We each gave up on gnawing our respective slices and threw this in the trash.  Ok, I did pick off the avocado slices first before doing so. THE ORIGINAL BBQ CHICKEN CHOPPED SALAD = this was ok and I did enjoy the fresh crunch of the jicama, but overall, nothing special.  I also realized at home that the ranch dressing was forgotten in my to-go order. I'll give you some credit for having friendly employees, but I won't be back for the food. Location is at The Lakes shopping center near the Thousand Oaks Civic Center.

Very bad experience here today Sunday 10/22.  Restaurant opened at 11:00.  We arrived at 11:30.  Place is less than half full, both inside and outside.  We were told 15 minute wait ??  Without explanation ?  Ok -we will wait.  25 minutes later, they have seated only one of the waiting parties.  We ask about our table, then we are told they are short servers, it will be another 10-15 minutes and we would not be out in time to see our show af the theatre next door that started at 1:00.  Never were we offered bar seating to get served quicker.  We cancelled our wait list and walked out to find somewhere else to get lunch before the show.  Umami Burger in the same center had us served & out in 40 minutes with plenty of time to catch our show.   Very poor experience that could have been handled much better by the guy at the check in station, Johnny.   Likely we will not be going here again at any time in the future.

This location at The Lakes is a long-time favorite of our Adored Grandson. We brought him here on a recent weeknight you thank him for helping us attack our garage clutter. We came on a night when the whole center was as quiet as I've ever seen it. Was surprised that the parking lot was so empty. No problem getting a table right away.  We sat out on the patio, even though it was in the cooler side.  I had a hard time picking a pizza, as some of the creative ones aren't on the menu any longer.  AG went for pasta with chicken, and was pleased with his choice. My traditional pizza was a bit past its prime when served, and I didn't care for the sausage that much. It was okay, but not worthy of a restaurant with "pizza" in its name! Best bets of the night were our server's smile and great attitude, plus the avocado/white corn guacamole, and the strawberry shortcake for dessert. The view from the patio is ever lovely - another plus. Overall, my thoughts are with the create your own pizzas for a reasonable price places abounding, traditional pizza restaurants like CPK need to step up their culinary game.  It's too expensive for what you get, in my humble opinion.

Been to this CPK many times, but just never thought of writing a review lol The location is great, especially if you are with kids. There's a great outdoor patio, heat lamps available and on if it gets chilly. It's near the small man made lake with ducks that you can watch. Also a playground is nearby. Got take out tonight. A kids meal for my son to bring to school tomorrow. Their pizzas a great. Good service and also great cocktails and wine if you choose. This location also offers curbside checkout which is nice!

My favorite place to eat!!! Yesterday I went with my family for dinner., the place was quite, the host immediately gave us a table, our waiter Matt, came right away and asked for drinks !!! Minutes after our beverages came and ordered the dishes... the food delicious!!! Just in time!!! Matt came at our table frequently checking if everything was ok and everything was perfect!!! My best experience in this restaurant!!! Thank you Matt!! Excellent service!!! Great food!!!

This was my wedge salad from CPK.  I had it, along with a pizza, delivered on Saturday October 28 at 8:22 pm.  I'm not sure where this salad is on the menu but I didn't order it.  Wedge salad has toppings rather than sprinkles of what might be egg and 2 bits of bacon.  Will not order from CPK again.  I wasted money.

I'm always happy to go to CPK because they have really good food, however, the dining experience leaves something to be desired.  My husband and I visited here on our way to the Reagan Library to grab a quick bite.  We were on somewhat of a time schedule as the library closed at 5:00 and it was about 2:30.  We ordered a small pizza and salad each and then proceeded to wait what was an extraordinary amount of time for our order.  We waited and waited and it wasn't overly busy but wasn't empty either.  We were just disappointed that it took so long and I had to even bring my pizza to go because we didn't want to miss a lot of time at the library because of waiting so long.  It also didn't help that two of the kitchen employees were on break or something in the booth right in front of us, for about as long as we were there.  So, all this to say yes, I will go back and order their food because it's good, but it will probably be to go.

One of friendliness staff I have seen is at this location.  The Wild Mushroom pizza is amazing. Thin crust, crispy and delicious. The Cobb salad is full of fresh ingredients.  Great atmosphere and high energy staff take care of you like a 5 star restaurant. You will not be disappointed in any way. Oh, the Strawberry Shortbread with ice cream is a perfect ending to the meal.

Early afternoon lunch yesterday (Sunday) resulted in typically good pizza and chopped salad. What we liked was consistently decent flavors and preparation. What we didn't like was the worst waitstaff experience we've ever had at a restaurant. She was disengaged and absent and I had to go find help twice. Maybe the B team was working because the restaurant wasn't very crowded; but regardless, it ruined the experience for us.
Poor service nagitive pressure to cold and the manager should do something about won't be going back

The manager is very very nice but my food was really not that great and my service was lacking. It's s fine spot if you are hungry and just want to eat something but don't expect much. My salad had other ingredients in it - not listed on the menu - and my server said "oh they must have started to make another salad and didn't remove all of the stuff." So my salad was used twice? I'm confused. My full portion size was also very very small! It looked more like a half and didn't even fill up the bowl it came in.

Love their salmon we always enjoy being outdoors at the lake. My kids love their pizza the steak with potatoes and arugula salad is really tasty. Manager always very attentive. I'm not fan of their salads or appetizers but main dishes are really good.

Ok. Wow. Where to start. Horrible. Orders not filled properly. Way. Way overpriced for what you get. Inexcusable.. For instance. A wild mushroom pizza..  no mushrooms...  not one. It was a curbside pick up and then we drove to a family members house to eat. By the time we noticed..  to late at that point to even call to fix it. But don't worry, the BBQ chicken pizza's were horrible also...   I used to eat here years ago. Still overpriced then, but at least back then the food was good.  NEVER Again..

I am over this place!! My kids school had a fund raiser here last month and on a night they know they will have a big crowd they were under staffed and had a half hour wait with a half empty restaurant?? We were starving and went next door. Then I went back last night and was outraged and the price of a pasta meal at $18- that is ridiculous for a family restaurant, and the portion was small and I was still hungry!! Pizza is always good, that is the only thing you should eat there. Salads average, they have cut back on portions and not as good as they use to be. CPK should lower prices and work on customer service.

Service here has for sure been kicked up a notch! We were greeted and seated right away. Our server came by quickly, took the kids orders and gave us a little more time to decide. He was friendly with a sense of humor. Ordered these and cheese and the kid cheese pizza. For ourselves we ordered a Thai chicken pizza bad a veggie pizza with goat cheese. The kids Mac and cheese was pathetic. Curly pasta with what looked like a powdered cheese sauce. Really had no taste. The kids cheese pizza was good and enjoyed. The Thai pizza was good, not great while the veggie pizza was very pretty, that is, if a pizza can be pretty. A manager came by our table twice to check on us asking if we needed anything else. Can't ask for more than that by way of service improvements!
Love CPK. Always. But salad was a little wilted that night. But we came for my nephews fund raiser so the dinner was great overall.

Excellent customer service. Awesome team work noted. Every member of this CPK was attentive to their customer. I did not see any server just standing or hanging out. Their Manager visited every table.  Definitely something to learn from this team. Good was good and fresh  good. Thank you to this CPK specially Jake and he mentioned his manager Justin for a pleasant happy friday for our family. Highly recommend this place.

Beautiful location in Thousand Oaks area for this CPK right by the Civic Arts Center. I took my mom here for a quick lunch today. Beautiful day and nice outdoor seating area. They have a full bar but only about 4-5 beers on tap. The bread was really good, but could be a little bigger.  I got the Spicy Chipotle Chicken pizza which was pretty good. I also got an Old Fashioned which was made surprisingly well. Can't imagine they make too many of those at CPK.  Definitely a thumbs up and I'd recommend. CPK always makes good pizzas but they also have a lot of other options on their menu. Tacos, sandwiches, soups, and the desserts looked very good! The food came out pretty quick too, but it seemed like a slow day. Friendly waitress and hostess.

I ordered DoorDash delivery service - 2 pizzas, 1 cup of soup (pre-made), 2 butter cakes (pre-made). 45 minutes after placing my order, my DoorDash delivery man called and advised that the restaurant had not started working on my order, did I mind waiting 20 minutes? I told him no problem. 30 minutes later I received a call from DoorDash corporate advising that California PIZZA Kitchen had run out of PIZZA dough. Obviously, I cancelled the order. Total dumpster fire of a restaurant. If the manager had called and apologized - and not thrown out some weak excuse an hour before closing about no more pizza dough..Totally wouldn't be making my first negative Yelp review. And they made the driver sit there and wait. Not cool. DoorDash handled everything like absolute professionals. CPK? Completely lost my trust. Wouldn't eat at any location if this behavior is condoned by management.
